name: Writing her own role
description: Mae West's signature swagger wasn't only the way she moved but the words she used as the screenwriter of her own dialogue. These stars have also written their own roles.

key_work.title: The sexual gangster
key_work.last_on_display_place: Australian Centre for the Moving Image
key_work.brief_description: Throughout her career, Mae West weaponised her words by writing plots that criticised gender conformity and moral hypocrisy. Using witty double entendres and innuendos that were hard to identify in the written script, she flouted the censorship laws of the Hays Code.

constellations_primary.name: Writing her own role
constellations_primary.description: Mae West's signature swagger wasn't only the way she moved but the words she used as the screenwriter of her own dialogue. These stars have also written their own roles.

end.title: 30 Rock
end.creator_credit: Adam Bernstein, Alec Baldwin, Andrew Singer, Brett Baer, Broadway Video, Carole Panick, Clint Koltveit, Colleen McGuinness, Dave Finkel, Don Scardino, Dylan Morgan, Eric Gurian, Irene Burns, Jack McBrayer, Jeff Richmond, Jerry Kupfer, Josh Siegal, Josh Silberman, Kay Cannon, Luke Del Tredici, Matt Hubbard, Nick Bernardone, Ron Weiner, Tracey Wigfield, Vali Chandrasekaran, William Sell, Little Stranger and Universal Television
end.brief_description: Liz Lemon, the head writer for a late-night TV variety show in New York, tries to juggle all the egos around her while chasing her own dream.

constellations_other.name: Writing her own role
constellations_other.description: Mae West's signature swagger wasn't only the way she moved but the words she used as the screenwriter of her own dialogue. These stars have also written their own roles.

links.description: By writing her own scripts Mae West controlled the tone of the worldly wise and sexually confidant persona she portrayed on screen. Comic Tina Fey also wrote many episodes of 30 Rock, in which she played Liz Lemon, “a sexually frightened know it all”.

start.title: 30 Rock
start.creator_credit: Adam Bernstein, Alec Baldwin, Andrew Singer, Brett Baer, Broadway Video, Carole Panick, Clint Koltveit, Colleen McGuinness, Dave Finkel, Don Scardino, Dylan Morgan, Eric Gurian, Irene Burns, Jack McBrayer, Jeff Richmond, Jerry Kupfer, Josh Siegal, Josh Silberman, Kay Cannon, Luke Del Tredici, Matt Hubbard, Nick Bernardone, Ron Weiner, Tracey Wigfield, Vali Chandrasekaran, William Sell, Little Stranger and Universal Television
start.brief_description: Liz Lemon, the head writer for a late-night TV variety show in New York, tries to juggle all the egos around her while chasing her own dream.

end.title: Girls
end.creator_credit: Apatow Productions, HBO and I Am Jenni Konner Productions
end.brief_description: The assorted humiliations, disasters and rare triumphs of four very different twenty-something girls: Hannah, an aspiring writer; Marnie, an art gallery assistant and cousins Jessa and Shoshanna.

constellations_other.name: Writing her own role
constellations_other.description: Mae West's signature swagger wasn't only the way she moved but the words she used as the screenwriter of her own dialogue. These stars have also written their own roles.

links.description: Like Tina Fey in 30 Rock, by creating her own show Lena Dunham could explore aspects of her life experience that she had not seen represented on screen before in the comedy series Girls.

start.title: Girls

end.title: Hannah Gadsby: Nanette

video_links.name: Hannah Gadsby: Nanette | Official Trailer [HD] | Netflix

end.brief_description: The Australian comedian Hannah Gadsby is taking an anti-comedy stance in her newest special.

constellations_other.name: Writing her own role
constellations_other.description: Mae West's signature swagger wasn't only the way she moved but the words she used as the screenwriter of her own dialogue. These stars have also written their own roles.

links.description: Lena Dunham made popular TV by mining her character Hannah’s messy life and poor decisions. In Nanette, stand-up comic Hannah Gadsby questioned the cost of turning traumatic personal experience into comedy material.

end.title: Red Hot Riding Hood
end.creator_credit: Tex Avery, William Hanna, Fred MacAlpin, Fred Quimby, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Rich Hogan
end.brief_description: Tired of always playing the same roles, Little Red Riding Hood, her grandmother and the Wolf demand a new version of the tale. The story then plays out in a more contemperary urban environment, with Little Red Riding Hood working as a pin-up girl in a night club.

constellations_other.name: Writing her own role
constellations_other.description: Mae West's signature swagger wasn't only the way she moved but the words she used as the screenwriter of her own dialogue. These stars have also written their own roles.

links.description: Mae West essentially plays the same character in all her films. Her enduring appeal lies in the humour and intelligence beneath the cartoonish visual of her sexy appearance. The showgirl vamp character found actual cartoon form in nightclub singer ‘Red Hot Riding Hood’.

start.title: Red Hot Riding Hood
start.creator_credit: Tex Avery, William Hanna, Fred MacAlpin, Fred Quimby, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Rich Hogan
start.brief_description: Tired of always playing the same roles, Little Red Riding Hood, her grandmother and the Wolf demand a new version of the tale. The story then plays out in a more contemperary urban environment, with Little Red Riding Hood working as a pin-up girl in a night club.

end.title: Dance, Girl, Dance
end.creator_credit: Dorothy Arzner, Edward Stevenson, Robert Wise, Erich Pommer, RKO Radio Pictures, Frank Davis, Tess Slesinger and Vicki Baum
end.brief_description: Judy O’Brien is an aspiring ballerina in a dance troupe. Also in the company is Bubbles, a brash mantrap who leaves the struggling troupe for a career in burlesque. When the company disbands, Bubbles gives Judy a thankless job as her stooge. The two eventually clash when both fall for the same man.

constellations_other.name: Writing her own role
constellations_other.description: Mae West's signature swagger wasn't only the way she moved but the words she used as the screenwriter of her own dialogue. These stars have also written their own roles.

links.description: Cartoon character Red Hot Riding Hood could have been modelled on burlesque star Bubbles (Lucille Ball) in Dance Girl Dance by pioneering female director Dorothy Arzner. The film contrasts Bubble’s career with that of a serious ballerina played by Maureen O’Hara
